New Records: Mohammad Amir returned to international cricket after four years and took 2-13 in the match.
New Zealand's lowest T20 total against Pakistan was 90, which was previously 80 in 2010.
Key Match Events: Mohammad Amir took a wicket off his second delivery in the match.
Ben Lister made a spectacular two-handed diving catch to dismiss Saim Ayub.
Pakistan won the match by seven wickets.
New Zealand was all out for 90 runs in 18.1 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized the importance of setting the tone in the first six overs.
New Zealand struggled due to the absence of nine frontline players from the Indian Premier League.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan captain Babar Azam praised the team's performance and highlighted the need to continue improving.
New Zealand captain Michael Bracewell acknowledged the team's effort but stated the need for improvement ahead of the next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series is a five-match series, with Pakistan leading 1-0 after two games.
The third match will be held in Rawalpindi, and the remaining matches will be in Lahore.
